intro: Echinocactus misleyi, commonly known as the Misley's cactus, is a species native to the Mexican state of San Luis Potosí. It is a columnar cactus with a distinct rib structure and spines that are typically reddish-brown in color. The plant produces yellow flowers during the spring and summer months, which are clustered at the ends of the stems. It is adapted to arid environments and requires well-draining soil and minimal water. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is often cultivated by cactus enthusiasts.
